definition: to ask sb to resign from a post
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: At 8pm last night， Mr Leung formally submitted his resignation to the chief executive.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚八時，梁錦松正式向特首請辭。

sentences.english: Mr Tung disclosed that Mrs Ip had submitted her resignation on June 25.
sentences.chinese: 董特首透露葉局長早於六月二十五日已向他請辭。

definition: Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
to leave office/to leave one's post
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
the end of fixed period in office/expiration of a term
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
